metadata.dc:author: Masa, Luis A
Villar, Alberto
Villamil, Iago
metadata.dc:description: We report a cutaneous abscess due to Gemella morbillorum, a Gram positive coccus found in oropharyngeal flora, that rarely causes disease in humans. Infections associated to this agent are similar to those related to viridans streptococci. There have been reports of endovascular infections (predominantly endocarditis) and also of acute invasive infections. Few previous reports are available of cutaneous infection.
metadata.dc:title: Absceso cut√°neo por Gemella morbillorum.
[Cutaneous abscess due to Gemella morbillorum].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista chilena de infectologia : organo oficial de la Sociedad Chilena de Infectologia
